Articles.Content: Can you return kerbals to the kscc to use them on another flight? or is that just revert flight option so far.

Those are some stunning features you have.

Back on topic: You can recover them from the tracking station, but they have to be on kerbin as far as I know. If they aren't on kerbin, revert flight, destroy the vessel, leave it there, or try and return it.

I almost forgot: You may not be able to return it. It depends where you bought the spacecraft from. Some dealers have some serious bull return policies.

Edited July 27, 2013 by Dusty926

Those are some stunning features you have.

Back on topic: You can recover them from the tracking station, but they have to be on kerbin as far as I know. If they aren't on kerbin, revert flight, destroy the vessel, leave it there, or try and return it.

lol i was very confused when i saw that avatar,

cool thanks, makes things more challanging
Just land them on Kerbin. You have the option then.
The identical avatars you have made it seem like one person was talking himself.

The identical avatars you have made it seem like one person was talking himself.

Well I gotta say he does look quite like me. Stunning features, dashing eyebrows, handsome chin, he's got all the good stuff like me!
you can recover the flight in the tracking station if they landed on Kerbin
What if you've already (semi-accidentally) killed them. Is there a way to hack the CFG file and get them back in the training center list?

What if you've already (semi-accidentally) killed them. Is there a way to hack the CFG file and get them back in the training center list?

No, you'd have to hack persistent.sfs to do that, and you don't need to, because unless you've already hacked it to turn permadeath on they'll go back on the active list on their own after awhile.
